channel.title: Compile errors. (4)
channel.description: [code]client.java:50: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Waiting location: class server sendQuest("Fight Pits Starts: "+server.Waiting+" ", 15898); ^ client.java:11371: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Waiting location: class server if(server.Waiting == 0 && Waiting) { ^ client.java:11371: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Waiting location: class client if(server.Waiting == 0 && Waiting) { ^ client.java:11374: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Waiting location: class client Waiting = false; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 4 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code] help... i was trying to code fight pits.

item.title: Compile errors. (4)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

This thread could not be filled with any more incorrect answers… Oh wait, ruler could post here.

[quote=“Gh0st Jr, post:5, topic:223848”]this is the only one i get now. client.java:11365: incomparable types: boolean and int If(waiting == 0 && waiting) {
i looked for boolean ant int… i couldn’t find it though.[/quote]
You can’t compare a boolean to a number.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors. (4)
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

public boolean isWaiting = false;

if(Waiting == 0 && isWaiting) { teleportToX = 2399; teleportToY = 5158; isWaiting = false; pitspanel(); }

item.title: Compile errors. (4)
item.dc:creator: @Gh0st_Jr Gh0st Jr
item.description:
@Gh0st_Jr wrote:

i know… its weird… but for the “waiting” thing these are waht i have

public boolean Waiting = false;

and

if(Waiting == 0 && Waiting) { teleportToX = 2399; teleportToY = 5158; Waiting = false; pitspanel(); }
how can i change so they dont error as the same?

ok, so you said to put

public boolean ISWaiting = false;

but wich would i use for this code (pits menu)

[code]public void pitspanel()
{

           setInterfaceWalkable(15892);
           sendQuest("Fight Pits", 15894); //Title

           //Left hand side
           sendQuest("Welcome to", 15895);
           sendQuest("Fight Pits", 15897);
           sendQuest("Fight Pits Starts: "+Waiting+" ", 15898);
           sendQuest("Players: "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+" ", 15899);
           sendQuest("Have Fun!", 15900);
           sendQuest(" ", 15901);
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors. (4)
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

on your compiler it says that 1 and 2 are both in server.java, not client.

add a new boolean like

public boolean isWaiting = false;

item.title: Compile errors. (4)
item.dc:creator: @Gh0st_Jr Gh0st Jr
item.description:
@Gh0st_Jr wrote:

  1. it IS in client.java.

  2. same

  3. done.

  4. done.

this is the only one i get now. client.java:11365: incomparable types: boolean and int If(waiting == 0 && waiting) {
i looked for boolean ant int… i couldn’t find it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors. (4)
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

error 1: Put the sendQuest in your client, not the server file, and take out the server. part too

error 2: same as 1 really.

error 3: “waiting” isn’t defined as a boolean in the client. add one for it

error 4: same as 3.

note: you have “waiting” as an int and a boolean, you’ll have to change the name of one of them to get it to work.

Read full topic
